cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SSW of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, turn northwest Sunday night or Monday, cross central-western Cuba, enter the Florida Straits and then track northward along/near Florida’s west coast toward the Big Bend area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida near the Tampa Bay / Big Bend region

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas (no watches yet for west-coast mainland Florida).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and Tropical-Storm Warnings limited to Haiti, Jamaica, and portions of eastern-central Cuba; none issued yet for Florida.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward through the Big Bend, including Tampa Bay/Manatee County shoreline
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Possibly – forecast totals 2–4" with isolated spots up to 6"
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely based on current guidance (1–2 ft possible Keys, none yet for west-coast FL)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) could reach the port as early as Tuesday afternoon with a 24–37 % chance over the next five days.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal surge of 1–2 ft possible if the center tracks just offshore; values above 3 ft are not indicated at this time.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands Tuesday–Wednesday could produce 2–6 inches and localized flooding around port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and rough seas in Tampa Bay approaches; possible short-fused tornadoes in outer bands.
